definition: tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper

sentences.english: They saw the lofty peak in all its majesty.
sentences.chinese: 他們看到了高聳的山峯，氣勢雄偉壯麗。

sentences.english: Japan's Mount Fuji, covered with snow, stands amidst the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 日本富士山，山峯高聳入雲，山巔白雪皚皚。

sentences.english: The mountain soars to heaven aBove all rivals.

sentences.chinese: 是玻璃幕牆高聳入雲的鬧市區？

sentences.english: Rammick lives high on a ridge in a 400-home subdivision.
sentences.chinese: 拉米克住在高聳的山脊上一片有400戶人家的地方。

sentences.english: Next door is a towering glass-and-steel apartment complex.
sentences.chinese: 隔壁是一座高聳的鋼鐵玻璃結構住宅綜合體。

sentences.english: From the high rock the castle gleams.
sentences.chinese: 城堡在高聳的岩石上閃爍。

sentences.english: The wind blew the waves into great peaks.
Fifteen brooms rose up, high, high into the air. They were off.
sentences.chinese: 十五支掃帚升了起來，高高聳起，比賽開始了。

sentences.english: Forget the soaring skyscrapers of Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 忘掉上海的高聳的摩天大樓吧。

sentences.english: Mountain glaciers are found in all parts of the world where mountain ranges are high.
sentences.chinese: 世界各地凡山脈高聳的地方都有山嶽冰川。

sentences.english: The skyscraper rears high into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 這座摩天大樓高聳入雲。

sentences.english: Lofty derricks dot the landscape in an oil field.
sentences.chinese: 高聳的井架點綴着油田的景色。

sentences.english: How will the Marquesas Islands fare with their high towering spire-like peaks?
sentences.chinese: 馬克薩斯羣島那些高聳的尖形山峯將面臨什麼？

sentences.english: Farewell to the mountains, high-cover'd with snow.
sentences.chinese: 別了啊，高聳的積雪的山嶽。

sentences.english: Four brightly dressed men climb to the top of a tall wooden pole.
sentences.chinese: 四名衣着鮮豔的男子爬到高聳的木竿頂端。

definition: perfectly straight/straight as a ramrod/bolt upright
gold and jade in glorious splendor (idiom)/fig. a dazzling sight (e.g. royal palace)
topography of a mountain/features of a mountain
